translation.en: [man over PA] Welcome to the store. Are you a Busy Beaver?
[Otto] No, I am not a Busy Beaver.
Join our rewards club for savings.
You can get your teeth into our dam good deals.
If you need help, ask a Beaver.
Hey. Oh. Can I, uh, help you with that, sir?
Do you think I don't know how to cut rope?
translation.ko: 밧줄 자르는 법도 모를 거 같아?

translation.en: No, it's just we usually do that for ya.
Do you think I'm gonna cut myself and bleed all over your floor and sue you?
translation.ko: 혼자 하다가 베여서 피바다 만들고 고소할까 봐?

translation.en: Then I don't need your help.
Did you, um, find everything you were lookin' for today?
You charged me for 6 feet of rope.
I didn't get 2 yards. I got 5 feet.
Yeah, we don't charge by the foot. We charge by the yard.
99¢ a yard is 33¢ a foot, times 5, that's 1.65.
No, I know, but I can't put it into the computer the way that you just said.
translation.ko: 그건 알지만 저희 컴퓨터에는 그렇게 입력 못 해요

translation.en: What the hell kind of computer can't do simple math?
translation.ko: 무슨 놈의 컴퓨터가 간단한 셈도 못 해?

translation.en: -Can I speak to your manager? -He's at lunch.
Lunch. All anyone cares about these days is lunch.
-Is there anyone else in charge? -You want the assistant manager?
This is the assistant manager? How old is she?
Shouldn't you be in gym class?
Let me cover that extra 33¢ for you.
Sir, I do not want your 33¢. And this is not about 33¢.
translation.ko: 그 돈은 됐소 돈이 문제가 아니라 팩트가 틀려먹었잖아

translation.en: This is about the fact that I got 5 feet of rope because I want 5 feet of rope.
translation.ko: 돈이 문제가 아니라 팩트가 틀려먹었잖아 5피트 필요해서 5피트 샀으니

translation.en: And I shouldn't have to pay for 6 feet of rope if I don't want 6 feet.
Did you want another foot of rope?

translation.ko: "주민이 아니면 쓰레기 버리지 마시오!" 자전거는 저기 둬야지

translation.en: -It belongs in the bike rack. -I was only gone half a minute.
Next time, I'll lock it up in the lost and found.
translation.ko: 다음엔 분실물 창고에 처박을 줄 알아

translation.en: Don't you dare let that little rat dog piss on my walkway again.
translation.ko: 또 우리 집 앞에 오줌만 싸게 해봐

translation.en: -I know it was you. -Ignore him, Prince.
He's a nasty, bitter old man. And he has no idea who's doing that.
translation.ko: 동네 꼰대 할아버지인데 증거도 없이 저런다

translation.en: Well, it was one of you.
And tell that useless boyfriend of yours to stop stretching his groin in public.
translation.ko: 그 식충이 같은 남자 친구한테 전해 길거리에서 가랑이 벌려대지 말라고!

translation.en: Looks like a 14-year-old Romanian gymnast, for God's sakes.
[man] There he is, the big man himself.
It's, well, retirement cake, I guess. Call it what you like.
Have fun with the rest of your life. We wanted to, you know...
You're the one who decided to leave.
And you did get a nice severance package.
You took me off Operations. You cut back on my hours.
You made Terry, who I trained, my supervisor.
translation.ko: 내가 가르친 테리를 내 상사로 앉혔잖소

translation.en: Terry, who can barely figure out what year it is without his phone.
translation.ko: 폰 없으면 올해가 몇 년인지도 모르는 애를

translation.en: So, yes, I took the severance package.
I'm sorry you see it that way.
We all had to adjust after the merger.
But you've been quite an asset to this company over the years, so--
We're gonna miss those schedules of yours.
Okay, Otto. Want a piece of your face?
No, no, no. Hey, you cannot use this road without a permit.
I'm not parking. I just dropped off a package.
translation.ko: 주차한 게 아니라 택배 내린 거예요

translation.en: The sign doesn't say anything about packages, does it?
It says "permits" and you don't have one.
This is not a through street.
Every time you come in here that means one of the residents can't park in front of their homes!
translation.ko: 이러면 주민들이 집 앞에 차를 못 댄다니까!

translation.en: The other guys don't do this. The guys with the white trucks.
translation.ko: 흰 택배차는 이런 짓 안 하더구먼

translation.en: How come it's always you brown guys?
And I don't mean that racially!
[woman's voice] Oh, hi. Sorry, can you hear me? Yes.
I have great news about your health insurance.
translation.ko: 건강 보험 관련해서 좋은 소식이 있어요

translation.en: Oh, no, no, no. Robot, robot, robot!
Well, who do I have to talk to to get this phone number disconnected?
Can you transfer me or should I press a number?
translation.ko: 연결해 줄 거요? 아님 내가 걸까?

translation.en: Well, I have been listening to that music for seven minutes.
I would like the electricity shut off at this residence.
-Are you moving home? -No, I am canceling the account.
And why can't you refund me for the six days?
translation.ko: 남은 6일 치는 왜 환불 안 된다고?

translation.en: Well, my policy is that if I'm going to pay for six days of gas,
then I will use six days of gas.
[in English] Go, go, go. Stop. Go.
Back. You're in the blind spot, be careful. Use the Force.
Good, good. No, you're going on the sidewalk.
What the hell is he doing?
[in English] Yes! Exactly! That's exactly what I was saying.
-Hey, you can't just drive here. -[radar beeping, then stops]
I'm not driving. Am I driving the car? No.
You can't just bring a car on this street without a permit.
translation.ko: 여긴 주차증 없인 차 못 들어와

translation.en: No, we have a parking permit. Right here. See?
What the hell's it doing in your pocket?!
That doesn't mean you can back the trailer up to your front door.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 인도에다 트레일러 대면 안 되지

translation.en: No, I wasn't. I was, uh, parallel parking.
Yeah, that, uh, didn't go so well, huh?
I'll just give it another try.
[Marisol in English] Keep backing away. Keep backing away.
[in English] The other way, but first the other way.
-No, no, no! Stop! Stop, stop, stop! Stop! -[yelling]
-Stop! Stop. Get outta the car. -[engine turns off]
How you could make it this far through life without knowing how to back up a trailer.
translation.ko: 후진도 못 하면서 여태 어떻게 살았어?

translation.en: My God, a dog with one front paw and cataracts coulda done better than that.
translation.ko: 백내장 걸린 외다리 개도 이것보단 잘하겠구먼

translation.en: And an automatic, of course. Give me the keys.
The trailer's too close to the side of the car.
That's why it's still beeping, but--
[in English] Oh, that was good, huh?
He just did it in one shot, huh?
Anyone who thinks they need to use radar to back up a car
shouldn't be allowed to drive one. They shouldn't be allowed to use the radio.
And the permit goes on the rearview mirror. Not in your pocket!
translation.ko: 주차증은 주머니가 아니라 룸미러에 달고 다녀!

translation.en: -Bye! Thank you! -Thank you, sir. That was very nice.
[Sonya] How much more shelf space is left?
-How many more boxes of books do you have? -[Sonya] Seven or eight.
[young Otto] Then I'll build you another bookcase.
translation.ko: 그럼 책장 하나 더 만들어 줄게

translation.en: Yeah, that's what I said. No? What did I say--?
It doesn't matter what you said. Otto. O-T-T-O.
Otto. Okay, so it's the same forward that is backwards.
translation.ko: 아, 철자를 뒤로 해도 오토가 되네요

translation.en: It's just you don't hear that name very often.
Okay. If we're interrupting, we can always come back.
That's why we go so well together.
She loves to cook, and I like to eat everything.
translation.ko: 아내는 요리 좋아하고 저는 식탐이 많고

translation.en: We wanted to properly introduce ourselves
because we're gonna be neighbors and everything, so...
-I'd say you're a little unfriendly. -I'm not unfriendly.
No, no, no, no. You're not unfriendly.
Every word you say is like a warm cuddle. It really is.
Be careful with the salsa, please.
It's, um, pollo con mole. It's really good.
It's a Mexican dish. I'm Mexican. [speaks in Spanish]
[in English] I was born in El Salvador because my father is from there.
But my mom is Mexican, so we went to first Mexico and then--
Okay, well, I have some things I need to do.
You wouldn't have an Alvin wrench I could borrow, would you?
It's "Allen" wrench, right? It's Allen wrench.
Everybody else I know calls it an Alvin wrench.
-Everybody else you know is wrong. -Oh, yeah? You wanna Google it?

translation.ko: - 환장하겠구먼 - 검색해 볼래? 검색해 봐, 위키피디아도 보고

translation.en: No, my phone. You use your phone.
Do you know what size you need?
We go because you have things to do, so...
That's a Chevy engine for you.
Not enough you can depend on in this world.
translation.ko: 세상에 믿을 만한 건 많지 않단다

translation.en: Maybe I should just run myself over with a car. That'll work.
translation.ko: 그냥 차에 뛰어들까 봐 그게 낫겠네

translation.en: Found some of the flowers you like.
I'm sorry I didn't get 'em here earlier.
Didn't even know an Allen wrench from one of the Chipmunks.
I know, I know. Maybe they can't afford to buy yet.
translation.ko: "소냐" 알아, 살 여력이 안 될 수도 있지

translation.en: But what will they do when those real estate bastards decide to tear down their house
translation.ko: 근데 악덕 부동산업자가 집 허물어 버리고

translation.en: and put up more of those ricky-ticky condos, huh?
It's gonna happen. I promise you.
They're already driving around the gates, driving right across the grass.
translation.ko: 벌써 차도 막 들어오고 잔디도 밟고 그래

translation.en: What idiot thought that was a good name for a real estate company?
translation.ko: 부동산 회사 이름을 누가 저렇게 지어?

translation.en: Can't even buy a decent screw hook anymore.
translation.ko: 갈고리못 하나 멀쩡한 걸 못 사는데

translation.en: Nothing works when you're not home.
I suspect you have hypertrophic cardiomyopathy,
which is a genetic enlargement of the--
Well, you'll likely be around a good long time,
but I'm afraid your military prospects end here.
One return ticket to Pittsburgh, please.
Miss, you dropped your book! Hey!
-Yes. I saw you dropped it, so I... -[chuckles]
I'm halfway through reading it. I would hate not knowing how it ends.
translation.ko: 반밖에 못 읽었는데 결말도 모를 뻔했네

translation.en: Oh, here. Why don't you join me?
I'm Otto. It was my father's name.
I'm on my way to visit my father right now.
Do you take this train a lot?
Oh, no, I had to come into town for my Army physical.
Oh, that must be so hard, not knowing what you're gonna face over there.
I'm afraid you're on the wrong train. This is an eastbound ticket.
translation.ko: 기차를 잘못 타셨네요 반대 방향 기차예요

translation.en: I'll get off at the next station.
There you go. Thank you. Have a good day.
Hey, Otto! A little late for your morning rounds, isn't it?
No? Aren't you supposed to be at work?
Oh. Cool. You wanna come over for lunch, then?
Well, it's pork tenderloin, in case you change your mind!
translation.ko: 돼지 안심 요리예요 생각 바뀌면 오세요!

translation.en: This is a private road, and these gates are to keep down the flow of traffic.
translation.ko: 여기는 사유 도로고 저건 차 막는 문이야

translation.en: Not so idiot drivers can go around them and tear up the grass.
translation.ko: 잔디 밟고 돌아가라고 만든 게 아니라

translation.en: -[music stops] -Okay. You got me. I'm with Dye & Merika.
translation.ko: 딱 걸렸네요 다이 앤 메리카 직원이에요

translation.en: I'm gonna have the groundskeeper come down and fix that up for ya, okay?
Good as new. Even better. You have a good one now, okay?
The rules are here for a reason.
I know what you guys are up to.
Okay, Mr. Anderson. Whatever you say.
-[dog barking] -Get out here, you little bugger! [grunts]

translation.ko: 하나만 더 던지면 그 개 발로 차서

translation.en: and I swear I'll dropkick that little rat dog of yours right over the roof.
translation.ko: 하나만 더 던지면 그 개 발로 차서 지붕 위로 날려버릴 거야

translation.en: No, I'm not throwing it at your house. That nasty cat scratched Prince.
I'm gonna kill that piece of shit.
[Barb] What do you care? It's feral.
It's probably full of all sorts of disgusting diseases.
So are you, most likely. I don't throw rocks at you.
translation.ko: 자네도 그럴 텐데 내가 돌 던지던?

translation.en: -[Andy] What's up? -Did you hear what he just said this time?
[Barb] I told you before about how he talks to me.
Get outta here while you can.
[Barb] Dye & Merika said they'll get all the old people on this street into a home.
translation.ko: 다이 앤 메리카에서 노인들 쫓아낼 거랬는데

translation.en: [in English] I just wanted to bring the wrenches back.
-I found one that came with the furniture. -Congratulations.
And I made you some salpores de arroz.
No. These are Salvadoran cookies. They were my father's favorite, so...
translation.ko: 아뇨, 엘살바도르 쿠키예요 아버지가 좋아하시던 거라…

translation.en: Also, Otto, I was wondering if you have a ladder I can borrow.
Why do you need a ladder?
Well, it's the one up there.
And you're gonna try to open it from the outside?
I like how his hands are waving.
Uh, Otto, hate to bother you, but, um, we don't have any heat.
Could you come take a look?
How would I go about that?
Well, it's hard to tell the difference sometimes with Otto.
By the way, we, uh, just moved to 206.
My husband, Reuben, is the one who used to handle the heat.
-Okay. -But we always knew a day would come
when he wouldn't be able to handle things around the house any longer.
translation.ko: 이젠 나이가 나이다 보니까 집 돌보는 일은 못 해요

translation.en: Maybe Reuben should have thought of that when he organized his coup.
That was a long time ago.
Otto, can't you just go breathe Anita's radiators for her?
translation.ko: 오토, 그냥 라디에이터 숨 쉬게 해주면 안 돼요?

translation.en: No. Because you don't breathe radiators.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 라디에이터 숨 쉬게 하는 게 아니라

translation.en: -Honey, look at this ramp. -[Anita] That's Sonya's.
-This is what we needed for the trailer. -Put that down.
Put that down! Who said you could touch that?!
-[Tommy] Sorry. -All of you get outta here. Go, go.
Take your ladder and go. Get outta here. All of you.
No. What are you doing in here?
translation.ko: 넌 또 여기서 뭐 하는 거야?

translation.en: How did you get in here? Come on.
Come on. Go! Get outta there.
No, get out. Get out of there.
You scratch me, I'll bite you.
I loaned you my garden hose last August.
If you give it back to me, I'll bleed your radiators for you.
So those new neighbors of yours, they seem quite lovely, don't you think?
Yeah, well, you may have some more new neighbors soon enough.
translation.ko: 조만간 새 이웃들이 더 생길지 몰라

translation.en: The realty people, they've been telling us...
Reuben and I have to move out.
translation.ko: 이 집 비우는 게 좋을 거라고

translation.en: No, that's a load of crap.
They don't own this house. You do.
Yeah, well, that's what I said.
They, uh, have been talking to our boy, Chris.
translation.ko: 우리 아들 크리스랑 얘길 좀 했나 봐

translation.en: Now he's saying that I can no longer take care of Reuben,
translation.ko: 걔는 이제 엄마가 아빠 못 챙긴다고

translation.en: that he needs to be in a special care place.
And I should move into a retirement home.
What does Chris know about it? He's an idiot. He always has been.
translation.ko: 그놈이 뭘 알아? 그 모자란 놈 같으니

translation.en: They can't make you do anything.
Does he even know we're here?
translation.ko: 우리 여기 있는 거 알기는 알아?

translation.en: Let me go find your hose.
[Otto] The whole neighborhood is falling apart these days.
They don't even have a homeowners' association anymore.
No one left to keep things running.
I just didn't realize you would fall to shit so quickly.
they're tearing apart everything we worked so hard to build.
translation.ko: 우리가 열심히 쌓아온 게 다 부서지고 있어

translation.en: I haven't even left yet, and they're trying to erase us.
translation.ko: 난 이렇게 멀쩡한데도 우릴 지우려 하잖아

translation.en: Well, I am not staying around to see that happen.
[Anita] I'm making that creamed corn you like. Oh, thank you.
Thank you, Otto. I'm sorry it took so long to give it back.
Um, you wanna stay for lunch?
Yeah, Anita made a pork tenderloin.
No, I have a lot of things I have to do.
Reuben, what are you doing, hon?
[Tommy] Try opening it from the inside a little.
I'm a little bit dizzy, honey.
[sighs] Looks like we'll both have to take the next one.
Did you have to go back to the military center?
No, I wanted to pay you back for the train ticket.
Wouldn't it be nicer if you invited me to dinner?
translation.ko: 저녁을 사는 게 더 좋지 않을까요?

translation.en: So, what kinds of things interest you?
I like knowing how things work.
I like knowing how things work.
What each part does to make a car run smoothly.
It's more complicated than people realize.
A carburetor has to mix gas and air in just the right combination,
translation.ko: 카뷰레터가 기름과 공기를 적정 비율로 혼합하고

translation.en: and then the spark plug has to ignite that mixture,
which drives the piston and the connecting rods and the drive shaft--
Where did you learn so much about cars?
It's all we really talked about. He was a good dad.
translation.ko: 우린 늘 차 얘기를 했죠 좋은 아버지셨어요

translation.en: Just how it felt when she was gone.
Why didn't you get an entrée?
translation.ko: 왜 메인 요리는 주문 안 했어요?

translation.en: So you could order whatever you wanted.
translation.ko: 먹고 싶다는 거 다 사주고 싶어서요

translation.en: I'm not in the Army. I couldn't pass my physical.
translation.ko: 나 입대 안 해요, 신검 떨어졌어요

translation.en: If I had, at least I'd have a job now, which is what I was counting on.
And I don't know what I'm gonna do.
-What are you doing here? -What are you doing?
-I'm looking for you. -Well, you found me.
Can you please take me to the hospital? Please?
Tommy fell off the ladder, and the ambulance just took him away.
translation.ko: 토미가 사다리에서 떨어져서 구급차 타고 갔어요

translation.en: Well, you can drive yourself in that imported toaster you call a car.
translation.ko: 그 같잖은 깡통 몰고 가면 되잖아

translation.en: And you don't have a driver's license?
I just never got to the other parts.
How many other parts are there?
Tommy is in the hospital, and he may be dying as we speak.
So are you gonna drive me to the hospital, or are you gonna make me take a bus?
translation.ko: 저 태워주실 거예요? 아니면 버스 타고 가요?

translation.en: -I will drive you to the hospital. -Thank you.
I'm going to get the children!
[Luna] Pick me up, pick me up!
Are they some kind of superheroes?
-I found a Mr. Bear book! -So I see.
translation.ko: - 프로레슬러 - 곰 아저씨 책 찾았어요! 그렇구나

translation.en: She wants you to read to her.
'Are you there, Baby Bear?' Mr. Bear says.
translation.ko: ''거기 있니, 아기 곰아?' 곰 아저씨가 말했어요'

translation.en: 'Where, oh where, is my Baby Bear.'"
[in deep voice] "'Where, oh where, is my Baby Bear?'
'Are you there, Baby Bear, up in that tree?'"
"'There's nobody here but baby and me.'
'Are you there, Baby Bear, deep underground?'"
-Do you want to see a trick? -Yes!
Actually, I was reading to them.
"Actually, I was reading to them," Mr. Bear grumbled.
Say, could I borrow a coin, Mr. Bear?
He doesn't even own the costume. That's owned by the hospital. He's gonna have to pay for that.
translation.ko: 자기 의상도 아니고 병원 거라 물어내야 해요

translation.en: Beppo means happiness. He volunteers his time to be here.
[in English] Otto. What the hell did you do?
It was all the clown's fault.
I hope you have a magical day!
Well, it came from your ear, sir, so that's a you problem.
"No, no, no. This is not your quarter."
Look. I gave you a quarter that I said I needed back.
translation.ko: 내가 그 동전 꼭 돌려 달랬지?

translation.en: -You want a dollar? -And you switched them on me.
-The ol' switcheroo. -You gave me this quarter.
Is Otto going to get in trouble?
-[Beppo] It's just a quarter. -[Otto] No, it's not.
-Do you see the copper? -He's not calling the coppers.
-I gave you a 1964 quarter. -Please calm down.
I want it back! Where is it?
translation.ko: - 1964년 동전이었어, 내놔! - 진정하세요 - 어디 숨겼어? - 도와주세요

translation.en: -You have it on you. -Officer, help me.
[officer] 129. We have a clown situation. Where is it?
Let go of the clown! Sir! Sir!
What pocket? There's a million pockets.
My father used to smile like that.
[Abbie] You should never be mean to a clown.
-What about Alvin Wrench, is he coming? -[gasps] Look!
[in English] Pull the car up please, so we pick him up.
-[Marisol] Thanks for driving us. -[Luna] Bye, Abuelo Luchadoro.
[Abbie] Look at your new leg! They look like a robot leg.
translation.ko: 아빠 다리 생겼네? 로봇 다리 같다

translation.en: [in English] Oh, my God, is he dead?
Otto. No, no, no, please. Please. Please. Take him out. Please.
Because I'm pregnant. I cannot handle the cats because I can get the toxo thing.
translation.ko: 임신 중이라 안 돼요 기생충 옮으면 어떡해요

translation.en: Well, he got himself in there. He can get himself out of there.
translation.ko: 제 발로 들어갔으니 제 발로 나오겠지

translation.en: [in English] Why are you like that?
We gotta warm you up, buddy!
Okay, let's go. I've got you now.
Oh, my God, it's so freezing here.
Okay, how about this one? Please?
No, no. Don't touch that coat. It'll stay here.
translation.ko: - 안 돼 - 이걸… 그건 만지지 마, 여기 둬야 돼

translation.en: -Okay. Can you please bring a blanket? -For the cat?
-It's okay. I got this. -What are you doing?
translation.ko: 그럼 내가 할게요 뭐 하는 거야?

translation.en: Oh, body heat works wonders. I've got plenty of body and heat.
I'm gonna turn on the oven.
You are not putting that cat in my oven.
[Marisol] No, I'm just trying to get some heat in the house.
Your counters are so low. Where did you get them?
I built them. For Sonya. For my wife.
She was a great cook though, wasn't she?
I used to eat here all the time.
Well, can you go now? I have things to do.
Well, it was great seeing ya, as usual.
Oh, hey, who's gonna look after this guy?
[Sonya] Now ask me the right way.
Okay, now I'm hungry. Now I'm hungry.
"The Board of Regents hereby certifies that Otto Anderson,
having completed all the requirements for a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering--"
Now ask me the right way.
-Somebody help him! -Get the camera on him. No, take video.
-Who's gonna do something? -Oh, my God, he fell.
-Get him off the tracks. Somebody help. -Hey! Can you move?
translation.ko: 누가 좀 올려줘요 이봐요! 움직일 수 있어요?

translation.en: You gotta move! Come on! You gotta get up!
-[man] Come on. -[woman] Film it, film it, film it.
-Get the shot. -I have him. I see him.
-Tell me what happened. -We were going to the museum...
Hey, are you out of your mind? You could have been killed.
Are you trying to scare me to death?
Abbie wanted to make a picture of her new neighbor.
She wants you to have that.
She always draws you in color.
I have a very good idea.
You can be my driver's instructor.
I don't have time for that.
But don't worry, I'll pay for the gas and everything.
Hey, there you guys are. I've been looking for ya everywhere.
-[cat meows] -Hi, Jimmy. What are you doing?
Let him out of the box.
What do you think you were doing? Taking him for a walk?
Well, I had to bring him back. I forgot that I'm allergic.
I put oatmeal on it, and it didn't help at all.
You know what, you come with me. Tommy has a prescription from last year.
translation.ko: 오트밀 발랐는데 도움이 안 돼요 우리 집 가요 토미 먹던 약 있어요

translation.en: -He found a wasp's nest. -Are you sure?
-I don't want to be a bother. -It's okay.
translation.ko: - 민폐 끼치기 싫은데 - 괜찮으니까 긁지 마요

translation.en: -Don't scratch. -I feel like I should scratch a little.
Hey, hey, what about the cat?
Uh, looks like he's yours now, Otto.
It's been harder than I thought to...
I have to figure out what to do with him.
Then I'll come to you, Sonya. I promise.
You are not taking over my bed.
Would you rather sleep outside, back in the snow?
You'll be the best dad our children could ever hope for.
translation.ko: 당신은 우리 애들한테 최고의 아빠가 될 거야

translation.en: Is this what you use that bike for?
Waiting tables and pumping gas, that's a job.
I also work nights at a pizza shop and weekends at a thrift store, so...
translation.ko: 밤엔 피자집에서 일하고 주말엔 중고 숍에서 일해요

translation.en: You used to come to presentations at school.
She was the first person that didn't treat me like a freak
translation.ko: 저를 멀쩡하게 대해준 첫 번째 분이에요

translation.en: She was the first to call me by my new name.
translation.ko: 제 새 이름을 불러준 첫 번째 분이에요

translation.en: She got the other teachers to do it too.
It really helped me at school.
I won't leave these here anymore.
Andy's teaching me how to drive.
You're still in drive! It's an automatic.
You were still in drive. You gotta put it into park.
Otto's here! My mom made her salpores.
I can't stand watching one idiot teach another how to drive.
translation.ko: 저 엉터리가 운전을 가르치는 꼴은 못 봐

translation.en: You. Put on your coat. It's lesson time.
[in English] You're gonna teach me? Really?
That's really, really nice of you, Otto. Thank you.
-Mama's going on a ride. -Be careful, honey.
Ah. Otto, pero can we go in our car?
translation.ko: 오토, 우리 차로 하시면 안 돼요?

translation.en: Because I've only ever driven automatic.
I'm teaching you how to drive. Get in.
Now, coming up on the red light. You're going to have to stop.
Okay, but I get the clutch, right?
You get the clutch and then press in on the brake.
-Do I hit the brake or the clutch? -No, keep the clutch in.
Put in the brake, I put the clutch.
Clutch and brake. And now brake.
-[in English] Don't shout at me. -I am not shouting at you.
translation.ko: 소리 지르지 마세요! 소리 안 질렀어

translation.en: Clutch in. It's in, it's in!
Clutch in, and brake. Brake. Brake. Brake.
The car is stopped. Don't hit the car! Brake, brake!
translation.ko: 저 차 멈췄잖아, 받으면 안 돼!

translation.en: Oh, my God, I almost hit the car. It's like this.
It doesn't matter. It's a hybrid.
-Okay, I should move back. -No, no, no. No.
-You're fine right where you are. -But I'm very close.
-Doesn't matter. -I don't need to go back?
-Just wait for the green light. -[rock music blaring over SUV speakers]
And here we go. So press in on the clutch.
And give it a little gas.
Slowly let out on the clu--
Press in on the clutch, shift into fi-- You don't have to turn the key.
translation.ko: 클러치 밟고 기어를… 열쇠 안 돌려도 돼

translation.en: -Oh, my God. [speaks in Spanish] -Press in on the--
-then press the gas. -I can't do this.
translation.ko: 천천히 클러치 떼고 액셀을 밟아 못 하겠어요

translation.en: -That is all you have to do. -I can't do this.
Did you not have to learn how to drive?
Calm down, old man. Hey, hey.
I'm not your old man! You son of a bitch!
translation.ko: 누가 네 할아비야? 이 염병할 놈!

translation.en: If you honk that horn one more time,
it'll be the last thing you do. You hear me? Huh?
translation.ko: 그 길로 인생 종 친다, 알았어?

translation.en: You have given birth to two children. Soon it'll be three.
translation.ko: 자넨 애를 둘이나 낳았고 이제 곧 셋이 돼

translation.en: You have come here from a country very far away.
you got yourself an education and a nitwit husband
and you are holding that family together.
You will have no problem learning how to drive.
My God, the world is full of complete idiots
translation.ko: 이 세상은 꽉 막힌 머저리들로 가득하지만

translation.en: who have managed to figure it out, and you are not a complete idiot.
translation.ko: 이 세상은 꽉 막힌 머저리들로 가득하지만 자넨 꽉 막힌 머저리는 아니야

translation.en: [Otto] Okay, there's a spot right there. Just pull up, parallel,
and back the car up until that bumper is in line with your side-view mirror.
Back up all the way up to the curb.
How did you find this place?
We used to come here every Saturday at 1:00.
I'd wash and wax the car,
and she would grade her papers and cook and spend the rest of the day reading.
translation.ko: 아내는 시험지 채점하고 요리하고 남은 시간은 책 보고

translation.en: I tried to read some of them, but...
Her friends said that we were like night and day.
My life was black-and-white before I met Sonya.
translation.ko: 소냐를 만나기 전에 내 삶은 흑백이었어

translation.en: She was a force of nature.
She convinced the school to start up a program
for the kids that needed extra help.
A lot of kids had problems at home or, uh, social anxieties.
translation.ko: 집에 문제가 있거나 불안장애 있는 애들인데

translation.en: But by the time Sonya was done with 'em,
I ran into one of her students,
[Otto] We all got along fine, of course, when we first moved in.
translation.ko: 처음 이사 왔을 땐 이웃과 사이좋았어

translation.en: [Otto] Sonya and Anita were best friends.
[young Otto] So I got my Allen keys...
And Reuben and I were a lot alike.
They build walls. They take offense.
Maybe it was all the construction that drove everybody crazy.
You know, there used to be a forest up on that hill.
That's why they call it Birchwood.
Then they started building all those condos and cut down all the birches.
translation.ko: 근데 콘도 짓는다고 나무를 다 벴어

translation.en: They didn't even realize what they were doing until we told them,
translation.ko: 우리가 항의하기 전엔 뭐가 잘못인 줄도 모르더라고

translation.en: But this was before the coup?
Oh, yeah, yeah. Reuben and I were friends then.
After that, all we saw were the differences.
A few years later, their son, Chris, he, uh, took a job in Japan,
translation.ko: 몇 년 후 그 집 아들 크리스가 일본으로 취직했고

translation.en: and I don't think he's been back to visit them since.
translation.ko: 그 후로 한 번도 안 온 것 같아

translation.en: -Oh. -Reuben and he never did get along.
Anyway, that's when I decided to bury the hatchet.
Sonya gave me this a while back.
I thought maybe we could start fresh.
Hey, would you like to see my new car?
You gotta change with the times.
I don't know what went wrong with Reuben, but that's when I knew I'd lost him.
translation.ko: 왜 그리됐나 몰라도 도저히 안 되겠더라고

translation.en: I mean, a man has to stand up for what he believes in.
Even if it is an F-O-R-D.
And you and Sonya, did you ever think about having children?
I was wondering if you could help us out tonight.
translation.ko: 혹시 오늘 저녁에 도와주실 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Me and Tommy don't get a lot of time to go out for dinner
I'm not gonna drive you two around on a date.
No. We're gonna take a cab.
What do you need me for, then?
-Mama, I did not! Why would I? -Yes, you did!
translation.ko: 엄마, 나 안 했어! 했잖아! 돌려줘!
했잖아! 돌려줘! - 나 잡아봐라! - 얘들아, 조심해

translation.en: [in English] And learn to share your everything.
[in English] No. Don't be silly. It's gonna be very fun.
If you remember, Abbie has to be in bed by 9:00, okay?
I'm setting it to "Armed Stay." Are you paying attention?
translation.ko: '거주 중'으로 세팅해 놓을게요 잘 보고 계시죠?

translation.en: So if you wanna go out,
you just have to press this button here, and it's disalarmed.
translation.ko: 나가실 땐 이것만 누르시면 돼요 그럼 해제돼요

translation.en: [Marisol] Be good to Abuelo Otto please, okay?
I don't see chocolate milk in here.
You make it with the syrup. But not too much. It'll keep her awake.
translation.ko: 시럽으로 만드는 거예요 조금만 넣어야 해요 얘 못 자거든요

translation.en: Dad said he wanted to throw it out the window,
but Mom said Dad isn't allowed to open windows anymore.
translation.ko: 엄마가 아빠는 창문 여는 거 금지래요

translation.en: [Otto] I don't think this is a good idea.
Because no one stands a chance against a luchadoro.
Rub it and smack! Smack! Karate chop!
[in English] Wow, it's awfully quiet, huh?
-Fine. -You did a good job tonight, Otto.
You should pat yourself on the back.
You can't hear your chain rattle when you switch gears like that?
translation.ko: 기어 바꾸는 소리 이상한 거 안 들리냐?

translation.en: -My bike's getting old. -Don't blame the bike.
You just have to adjust your derailleur.
I'm, um, looking for Otto Anderson.
Are you sure you wanna do that?
You treat it right, it'll treat you right.
I can't believe I'm helping you throw crap onto people's lawns.
translation.ko: 전단지 무단 투기를 돕게 될 줄이야

translation.en: I'm saving up for a car.
Young lady, you're blocking the garage.
Mr. Anderson? My name is Shari Kenzie.
I'm a social media journalist, and I--
I have an online series called Everyday Heroes.
What you did the other day at the train station was amazing.
No, I don't. I've watched the video at least a dozen times.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 그 동영상 수십 번 봤는걸요

translation.en: Oh. A commuter recorded what happened on their phone and posted it online.
Someone in the comments recognized you. That's how I tracked you down.
translation.ko: 알아본 사람이 댓글 썼길래 물어물어 온 거예요

translation.en: It's gotten over a million views.
Why can't people mind their own business?
Because stories like yours are inspiring.
If I could just talk to you for a few minutes--
No, now I've got too many things I have to do.
I recorded a video message from the man you saved.
-Um... just pull it up. -[Marisol] Otto! Hi!
-So you ready for another driving lesson? -[pounding on garage door]
[Shari] Hello? Hello? Hey, I'm still in here!
Turn the knob, open the door.
-[speaks in Spanish] -Opened a door before, haven't you?
Good. I'm not through with my rounds.
What the hell does that even mean?
Buncha knotheads pointin' a camera at themselves.
translation.ko: 자기들 얼굴에 카메라 들이밀고 설치는 게 전부면서

translation.en: I thought you handled it really well.
I mean, closing her in your garage.
Otto, also, I was thinking you've done so much for us.
-I wanna do something for you too. -I don't need anything.
translation.ko: - 뭐 해드리고 싶어요 - 필요한 거 없어

translation.en: Well, I think you could do with some decent food. Sometimes. No?
Those are not bad. They're not bad.
that I can help you clean out your house and clean out the front hall in your home,
and help you pack the coats and shoes you have there of Sonya's.
No, but it can help you move on.
translation.ko: 그래도 이렇게 해야 새 출발 하시죠

translation.en: She's always gonna be with you.
When my father died, my mother, she stopped living.
translation.ko: 아빠가 돌아가셨을 때 엄마는 삶을 관두셨어요

translation.en: -She just stopped like she used-- -Stop talking!
Why can't people mind their own business? Idiots.
translation.ko: 자기들 인생에나 신경 쓸 것이지 머저리들

translation.en: The more they babble, the more they drown out the memory of her voice.
translation.ko: 다들 하도 쫑알대니까 소냐의 목소리도 가물가물해

translation.en: I don't want to clear Sonya from my life.
translation.ko: 내 인생에서 소냐를 지울 생각 없어

translation.en: There was nothing before her, and there's nothing after!
translation.ko: 그 사람 이전에도 이후에도 아무것도 없어!

translation.en: Stop right there. You stop that car!
Did you leave that gate open? You left that gate open, didn't you?
You're the only one who gives a damn.
I give a damn about people following the rules.
translation.ko: 내가 신경 쓰는 건 규칙 준수야

translation.en: Yes, I know. I know all about you.
There's a file on you at the office. It's this thick.
translation.ko: 어르신에 관한 파일이 이렇게 두껍게 있어요

translation.en: I know about your wife. How you blame whatever happened to her on everybody else.
translation.ko: 부인 일도 알아요 그걸 딴사람들 탓으로…

translation.en: Don't you say one more word. [gasping]
Take it easy, Otto. Look, I'm not trying to upset you,
but you really shouldn't be living alone.
translation.ko: 이렇게 혼자 사시면 안 된다는 거예요

translation.en: I mean, we know more about you than you probably realize, so...
Just look after that heart of yours, okay?
What do you know about my heart?
Hey, what do you know about my heart?!
Otto, what's going on? Are you okay? Do you feel okay?
You wanna help me, close the gate.
There you are. ♪ Of all the things we should've said That we never said ♪
But now we have to live.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to--
The generator blew and the power is out.
I was hoping you might let me crash on your couch for the night.
There's a sofa you can use.
Don't go into the dining room. The ceiling needs repair.
translation.ko: 주방 쪽엔 가지 마라 천장 망가졌으니까

translation.en: It's upstairs in Sonya's old study.
So why did he kick you out?
I read too much. I don't like sports. Take your pick.
translation.ko: 책만 보고 스포츠 싫어하고 한두 가지가 아니에요

translation.en: Good morning. The power's still out
translation.ko: 일어나셨어요? 전기가 안 들어와서 달걀 상할까 봐 썼어요

translation.en: so I cooked up the last of the eggs while they're still good.
translation.ko: 전기가 안 들어와서 달걀 상할까 봐 썼어요

translation.en: I have to do my rounds.
Don't you at least want some coffee first?
You mind if I join you? I need to get my steps in.
translation.ko: 같이 가도 돼요? 운동도 할 겸

translation.en: Hey, Otto, if you want to slow down, we can 'cause my beats are up.
translation.ko: 좀 천천히 갈까요? 심장이 빨리 뛰어서

translation.en: Otto, did you hear they're moving Reuben into assisted living this afternoon?
They convinced Anita to sell the house.
No, they made the deal with Chris.
-Chris? He can't do that. -Yeah, he can.
After Dye & Merika found out Anita had Parkinson's,
So last year Chris convinced Anita to give him power of attorney in case she got worse.
translation.ko: 그래서 작년에 크리스가 미리 위임장 받았어요

translation.en: So Dye & Merika made the deal with Chris to buy the house.
translation.ko: 그 권한으로 이 집을 팔아넘긴 거예요

translation.en: Wait, Anita found out she had Parkinson's last year?
She would've told Sonya. Sonya would've told me.
translation.ko: 그럼 소냐에게 말했겠지 나도 알았을 거고

translation.en: Well, Anita and Reuben didn't want you and Sonya to know.
They said you had enough on your plate as it is.
I need to see everything you ever got from Dye & Merika.
translation.ko: 다이 앤 메리카에서 받은 거 다 줘봐

translation.en: Notices, letters. Do you have a copy of the power of attorney?
How do you know about that?
And any records of Reuben's condition and yours.
I got so wrapped up in my own troubles, I stopped thinking of anyone else.
translation.ko: 내 문제만 생각하느라 남들 생각을 안 했어

translation.en: And I figured they weren't thinking about me.
translation.ko: 남들도 내 생각을 안 하겠거니 했지

translation.en: This isn't easy to say after all this time.
And I will sort all this out.
I need to use your phone.
Why can't you use your own?
Mine is disconnected at the moment.

translation.ko: 왜요? 그건 몰라도 돼 전화만 좀 쓰자니까

translation.en: I just need to use your phone, okay?
translation.ko: 그건 몰라도 돼 전화만 좀 쓰자니까

translation.en: You won't tell me why your phone is disconnected?
translation.ko: 전화 왜 끊겼는지도 말 안 해주시고

translation.en: You won't tell me why you need to use my phone?
translation.ko: 왜 전화 쓰시려는지도 말 안 해주시고

translation.en: You won't tell me what happened to you in the street yesterday?
translation.ko: 어제 왜 그러셨는지도 말 안 해주시고

translation.en: And then you went inside and you wouldn't even open the door?
Do you know how long I was out there?
And I didn't know if something had happened to you.
Or if something was gonna happen to you.
And I'm sorry if I said the wrong thing about Sonya's coats.
But I was just trying to help.
And you left me out there.
So, no. You can't use my phone.
translation.ko: 그러니까 안 돼요 전화 못 빌려드려요

translation.en: You think your life is so hard because everybody's an idiot
and you have to do everything on your own, right?
And I think you should just be happy
that someone was trying to help you get through a crappy day.
translation.ko: 도와주려는 사람들이 있는 게 행복한 거죠

translation.en: are trying to force Anita and Reuben out of their home.
That's why I need to use your phone.
We had never had a vacation.
translation.ko: 우린 휴가 한 번 제대로 못 갔지

translation.en: And she wanted to do something special before the baby came.
translation.ko: 출산 전에 특별한 걸 해보고 싶다더군

translation.en: So we booked a trip to Niagara Falls.
On the way back, the bus crashed.
There'd been a recall on the brake lines,
but the company never had them fixed.
After three months, she was finally able to come home.
But they had started building the new condos
and the community center and the walkways,
none of which were designed for people in wheelchairs.
translation.ko: 휠체어 탄 사람을 전혀 배려하지 않았어

translation.en: The builders could have changed their plans.
But the laws weren't in place back then, and they didn't care.
-We're putting in a new playground... -I cared.
-There's places for people like your wife. -And I was so angry.
translation.ko: - 이런 사람들은 다른 곳에… - 그래서 화가 났어

translation.en: What does that mean? People like her? What does that mean?
translation.ko: 무슨 소리예요? 이런 사람? 무슨 소리야?

translation.en: -What're you tryin' to say?! -[yells] Get off of me!
That's when they voted me out as head of the homeowners' association.
I wanted to obliterate them all.
The builders, and the realtors, and the bus company, the bus driver.
translation.ko: 건설사, 부동산업자 버스 회사, 버스 기사

translation.en: I never would have let it go...
Sonya said we had to keep living.
translation.ko: 소냐가 우린 계속 살아가야 한다고 했지

translation.en: Six months ago she passed away.
I was going to join her.
That's why I had them disconnect my phone.
But now I think she wants me to keep living.
translation.ko: 그런데 소냐가 아직은 오지 말라는 거 같아

translation.en: And I have things to do.
It's a done deal. Reuben's coming with us.
And if you get in our way, I'll have you arrested.
-I'm not doing a thing. -Don't you take another step.
translation.ko: 난 가만있을 거야 한 발짝만 더 와봐

translation.en: You are not taking my husband away from me.
Anita, please. We're doing this for your own good.
translation.ko: 어니타, 이러지 마세요 두 분을 위한 일이에요

translation.en: What you're doing is trying to take my property.
I want Reuben to stay right here for the rest of his life,
Okay, but who's gonna take care of Reuben when you're no longer able to?
translation.ko: 아주머니가 힘들어 지시면 루벤을 누가 돌보고요?

translation.en: Who's gonna take care of you? Otto?
Otto's not in the best health either. Are you, Otto?
-What are you doing? Put that down. -Anita and Reuben are like family to me.
translation.ko: 뭐 하는 거예요? 내려놔요 어니타와 루벤은 가족이나 다름없어요

translation.en: I'll take care of them as long as they need.
Uh, their son, Chris, has decided they're not fit enough to be on their own,
and so what we're doing is--
Excuse me. When was the last time Chris saw his parents?
translation.ko: 잠시만요 크리스가 부모님을 뵌 지 얼마나 됐죠?

translation.en: He lives in Japan. They've been estranged for 10 years.
Chris would have no idea how his parents are doing,
except for what you told him.
All right, all right, shut that camera off. You can't film this.
translation.ko: 저기… 카메라 꺼요, 찍으면 안 돼요

translation.en: You told Anita's son, Chris, that she had Parkinson's,
but Anita never told anyone about her diagnosis.
I'd have to check the records.
Mr. Anderson over there is something of a local hero.
translation.ko: 저기 앤더슨 씨는 이 지역 영웅이세요

translation.en: He tells me you know details about his private health records as well.
translation.ko: 저분에게 듣자니 저분의 건강 상태도 알고 계신다던데

translation.en: So how are you and your company
getting illegal access to the medical records of seniors?
translation.ko: 노인들의 진료 기록을 불법적으로 보시는 거죠?

translation.en: Okay, let's go. We're done. We're done.
-Get that goddamn camera out of my face. -[Tommy] Goodbye.
I first uploaded Anita and Chris's story an hour ago.
translation.ko: 어니타와 크리스의 사연을 한 시간 전에 올렸는데

translation.en: Already dozens of people are saying
Dye & Merika forced them out of their homes.
translation.ko: 다이 앤 메리카에 집을 뺏겼다고 하네요

translation.en: [Shari] If you have a story, share it with me at Shari_Kenzie.
translation.ko: 제보하실 내용이 있다면 언제든 연락 주세요

translation.en: -I got it. I got it. -[Otto laughing]
[Tommy] Hey, you forgot to shut the gate!
[Otto] You see that? He just rolled right over. Gave up.
In our day, the bastards would at least put up a fight.
They haven't gotten rid of us yet.
It does feel pretty good. Doesn't it?
[Shari] Neighborly neighbors, a thing of the past?
Well, I'm here with eyewitnesses Anita and Jimmy to find out more.
Jimmy, you mentioned that Anita and Reuben are like family to you.
translation.ko: 지미, 두 분이 가족과 다름없다 하셨는데

translation.en: Well, I have dinner at their house nearly every single night.
I know what you're waiting for. You're ready for lunch, aren't you?
translation.ko: 얼굴 보니 알겠구먼 점심 먹고 싶지?

translation.en: [Shari] You moved into this community recently.
-How has that been for you? -It's been beautiful.
translation.ko: 최근 이사 오셨는데 어떠세요? - 너무 좋죠 - 이웃들도 너무 좋고

translation.en: [Shari] And your family, to have people there that are--
-Ms. Mendes? You can see him now. -Yes?
Mr. Anderson listed you as next of kin.
Your uncle had a close call. Has he spoken to you about his condition?
Basically, his heart is too big.
translation.ko: 쉽게 말해 심장이 너무 큰 거죠

translation.en: You're really bad at dying, you know that?
[in English] Otto, I think it's time.
Oh, uh, I'm a cardiologist. I'll page OB for you.
Everyone, this is our friend Otto.
Sorry, is this about the cars that are in front?
I gave it a fresh coat of paint.
Thank you. Okay, hold him one second, please.
Hold him. Oh, he's gonna cry.
[in English] I'll be right back, bebé. Okay.
-[fussing] -Uh, should I put this thing back in him?
Uh, well, let me show you how this works.
You don't have to do anything.
[Otto] Sonya, this is Abbie and Luna. They have something for you.
-That's, uh, brand-new little Marco there. -[speaks in Spanish]
And Marisol, Tommy. I told you about them.
translation.ko: 마리솔, 토미 이 친구들 얘긴 했지?

translation.en: She loved pink flowers, girls. You chose well.
All right, Malcolm, check that oil. Check it.
And let's see, what does it say?
-Oh, my gosh. -Saved you from a Volkswagen.
I have a car! I have a car!
-[Jimmy] This is your car! -[Malcolm] Are you kidding me?
-Let's go for a ride? -That's a nice truck, Otto.
Yeah? Wait till you see how it rides.
[Abbie] This is like Otto's luchador monster truck.
[Luna] Yeah. Do you have any comics?
-I can't believe Marco's 3 already. -You're such a big boy.
if you're reading this, don't worry.
It turns out having a big heart isn't as nice as it sounds.
The doctors warned me it would get me in the end,
translation.ko: 의사가 언젠가는 이런 날이 올 거라길래

translation.en: so I planned ahead, that's all.
The cat eats tuna twice a day
translation.ko: 고양이는 하루에 참치를 두 번 먹고

translation.en: and likes to do his business in private.
We remember before you this day...
Just a remembrance of some sort...
for those people who thought I pulled my weight.
translation.ko: 내가 열심히 살았다고 생각하는 사람들 모아서

translation.en: A local hero and good friend of the show is being remembered today.
translation.ko: 영웅이자 좋은 친구가 오늘 세상을 떠났습니다

translation.en: Jimmy, would you like to say a few words about Otto?
translation.ko: 지미, 오토에 관해 몇 마디 해주실래요?

translation.en: In your honor, Malcolm and I are doing
translation.ko: 오토, 사랑해요, 뜻을 이어받아 맬컴과 함께 꼬박꼬박 순찰할게요

translation.en: all of your rounds without fail around lunch and on weekdays.
translation.ko: 맬컴과 함께 꼬박꼬박 순찰할게요 점심때쯤 돌고 주중에만요

translation.en: [Otto] My lawyer will give you access to my bank accounts.
translation.ko: "안녕, 할아버지" 내 변호사가 내 계좌를 넘겨줄 거다

translation.en: I never wasted money on crap,
so you'll have enough to get the children through school.
And do what you like with the rest.
translation.ko: "소냐 앤더슨 위기 청소년 기금" 나머진 알아서 해라

translation.en: [Otto] The house, and everything in it, is yours,
translation.ko: 내 집과 살림은 모두 네게 남기마

translation.en: so long as you promise never to sell it to those real estate bastards.
translation.ko: 부동산 놈들에게 안 판다고 약속만 한다면

translation.en: Or anyone else, for that matter.
I'm trusting it with you alone.
Because you are not an idiot.

translation.ko: "삶의 희망이 보이지 않을 땐 혼자 고민하지 마세요"

translation.en: ♪ How your love is the best of me ♪
translation.ko: "더 이상 혼자가 아닙니다 전국 어디서나 국번 없이 129"

translation.en: ♪ Yeah, there's so much I want you to know ♪
♪ Guess I'll wait till you're home ♪
